content.rendered:
Let me take it for you.

If you haven’t read the original piece by Liddle, I suggest that you don’t and that you stop reading this too. That way you’ll have withheld the one thing Rod Liddle needs to survive: attention.

If you haven’t turned back already then its already too late for you, you might as well read Liddle’s piece here and then come back.

Rod Liddle is a troll. Contrary to what most people think it wasn’t kids or the internet who inventing trolling, it was Rod Liddle. Long before 10-year olds were shouting racist epithets down a £10 Xbox mic, Rod Liddle was calling Muslims savages. Long before Fifa obsessed adolescents were telling girls to make them a sandwich, Rod was being a crusty old creep, propositioning Harriet Harman on the front page of the Spectator.

And when people took a step back and said, hold on Rod this is actually pretty weird, what did he do? Why of course, he turned around, smirked and revealed that it was all just a joke! You see, he wasn’t actually a creepy old man he was merely parodying being a creepy old man.  

When Liddle was accused of being a racist for printing blatantly false claims about the African-Caribbean community, Liddle instead held up his hands in surrender and claimed, he was just asking questions.

If this doesn’t sound like an internet troll to you then you clearly have never been on the internet. In many ways he is the godfather of trolling, he craves reaction and attention more than they do and by and large he gets it.

Sure, there are others who would possibly stake a claim for his crown: Piers Morgan and Katy Hopkins come to mind. However, there is no question Rod was there first.

This latest article is just more of the same charade. However, with one caveat: all beasts, even trolls, are mortal. As trolls continue to scream for attention people gradually become accustomed to the ringing in their ears and learn to ignore it. This is why they have to change their tune.

Some just go for broke, a la Katy Hopkins calling for A Final Solution against all Muslims. But Rod, Rod is an auteur, he knows better. Instead he’s gone for a new target which will know doubt provide a bit of sustenance at least for a while. Of course, there is the usual drivel about Muslims and women, an old dog can’t learn new tricks that easily.

Ultimately, all things must come to an end and so must Rod Liddle. Internet trolls usually get banned after a while from whatever platform they are on. But the Spectator in the name of “Freeze Peach”, has valiantly defended Rod and likely will until the bitter end.

As we all get accustomed to the peculiar form of Rod Liddle tinnitus that we all bare (I call it Liddinitus) just remember that doctors agree that the best cure is to go and do something productive engaging to distract yourself.

So, go and vote and join the more than 270,000 people under 35 that have registered to vote in the last few days.

excerpt.rendered: Tom takes Rod Liddle’s bait so you don’t have to.
